Definition: In this task, you are given an utterance and recent dialogue context containing past 3 utterances (wherever available). Your task is to output 'Yes' if the utterance contains the vouch-fair strategy, otherwise output 'No'. Vouch-fair is a selfish negotiation strategy. It is used to call out fairness for personal benefit, either when acknowledging a fair deal or when the opponent offers a deal that benefits them. This can be through an explicit call out or can be implied.

Positive Examples.input:
Context: 'Yeah, I'm going to the desert so I'm hoping to have enough water. I'm good on food and I hunt for a lot of it anyways.' 'I've never been a good hunter. I wish I had those abilities.' 'I would part with all the food if I could get all the firewood.'
Utterance: 'That seems fair. How about water. How would that be split? I'm very concerned.'
Positive Examples.explanation: This is correct since the participant points out that the proposed deal seems fair.

Positive Examples.input:
Context: 'I really need that extra food for me and my bother. we have one to spare' 'so what is the whole deal here? ' 'you get 3 firewood I get 3 waters and now food I will give you 1 if that is ok🙂'
Utterance: 'and I have to give you more food or not?'
Positive Examples.explanation: Correct. The participant does not call out the fairness of the deal in any way.

Negative Examples.input:
Context: 'Heck yes! I am excited. How about you?' 'I can't wait 🙂 Let's talk about these supplies. I've got hungry mouths to feed, Can I take the food and you can have half the firewood and all the water?' 'Hmm, I need food too. I am willing to split. I will give you 2 food since you claimed it first. Can I have 2 waters then?'
Utterance: 'That's fair, but I have wiggle room on the water, how about I take two food, two firewood and you take 3 water, 1 food, 1 firewood?'
Negative Examples.explanation: The participant explicitly points out that the proposal by the opponent is fair so this is wrong. The correct answer would be 'Yes'.

Negative Examples.input:
Context: 'You can take two firewood an i can get one. I really don't need much. of that. are you okay with that?' 'I am okay with that 🙂' 'okay an for as the water two for me an 2 for you right? are you sure?'
Utterance: 'Yes, as long as I can get two of the food. '
Negative Examples.explanation: This is wrong since the utterance does not refer to the evaluation of the deal. The correct answer is No.

Instances.input:
Context: '2 food , 1 firewood ,2 water for me is it ok?' 'not fair at all☹️' 'then what will do, '
Utterance: 'if you take two food, then I take all the wood and two two water and one food'

Context: 'i think its fair, do you, i think anything extra at this point in time is better than having nothing' 'look  mate, let me have 3 on food and 2 on firewood, you can have the water and i on firewood' 'why would you not just take 2 packs of each whiile i onlt keep 1?'
Utterance: 'Alright fair enough, let me have 3 on food, 1 on firewood and 1 on water. This trip means alot to me'

Context: 'But If I will give you these items I don't get enough package friend.' 'i understand friend, we going to a snow fall place so we need fire wood and sicked and kids are in my team so i need food and water' 'Okay I will give you 2 firewood 2 food and 1 water.'
Utterance: 'food and water is ok, but i must need 3 pack of fire wood friend'

Context: 'Since you would also like firewood, I propose 2 firewood, 2 water to me, and you get 1 wood, 1 water, and all the food to make up for it.' 'Okay I can agree to that deal.🙂' 'That's fantastic, I'm glad we came to something we both agree with'
Utterance: 'Me too. I hope you have a wonderful camping trip.🙂'

Context: 'Okay then shall I take 2 packages of food and all the packages of water?' 'Yes, and I'll get 1 package of food and all of the firewood.' 'Okay I think this might be a good deal. '
Utterance: 'Actually, I've just thought about it and I'd also like one package of water. I think it'd be fair being that you're getting 2 packages of food.'

Context: 'What does that mean?' 'means water and firewood  i need majority then only it will balence' 'make firewood majority for me'
Utterance: 'unacceptable.  I am giving you food as your priority as you requested.  I require compensation for that.'

Context: 'Hi!  The weather is going to be a lot colder than I anticipated, so I need extra firewood.  Would you be willing to give some to me?' 'Sure, but I need 2 packs of firewood and 2 packs of food and water'
Utterance: 'That doesn't really sound fair to me ☹️'

Context: 'Hi! I'm very excited for the upcoming camping trip!! 🙂' 'Me too! 🙂 What do you think about the extra supplies?' 'I recently bought two new puppies, and they are coming on the trip. I could really use the extra water for them!'
Utterance: 'Awww. That sounds reasonable to me. I'm hoping to have a birthday dinner for my dad on the trip, so I'd appreciate some more food and a little more firewood.'
